column2: NEW MEXICO PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. As long as you don’t leave the road, you may legally pass a vehicle on the right:
column8: when you are turning into a one-way street with no oncoming traffic.
column10: if you are on a two-lane, two-way road and the other vehicle is turning left.

column2: 2. If you see orange construction signs and cones on a freeway, you must:
column4: make a U-turn because the lane ends ahead.
column6: be prepared for workers and equipment ahead.
column8: maintain your current speed while changing lanes.

column2: 3. When you are involved in an accident, you should:
column8: help the injured.

column2: 4. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.
column6: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.
column8: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.

column2: 5. If a tire blows out, drivers should:
column4: hold the steering wheel tightly and use the brakes lightly.
column6: apply the brake firmly and hold it.
column8: pull over quickly.

column2: 6. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column6: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.
column8: keep less space in front of their vehicle.
column10: keep more space in front of their vehicle.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column8: Reduction in lanes

column2: 8. Which signs have black letters on a white background?
column8: Warning signs (diamond)

column2: 9. When dust is blowing across the roadway making it difficult to see other vehicles, you should drive slower and turn on your:
column8: parking lights.

column2: 10. Warning signs normally are:
column8: octagons.

column2: 11. This warning sign means:
column6: Watch out for children crossing the street
column8: Slow down, drive with caution and watch for children

column2: 12. These are:
column8: miles-left signs.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column8: Drivers must turn right
column10: Right turn permitted on red light

column2: 14. Drivers should always look carefully for motorcycles before changing lanes because:
column4: motorcycles are not permitted to share traffic lanes.
column6: motorcycles always have the right-of-way at intersections.
column8: motorcycles are smaller and harder to see.

column2: 15. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column4: As close as possible to the center line.
column6: As far to the right as possible.
column8: On the right curb.

column2: 16. After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane:
column4: when you see the front bumper of the other vehicle in your mirror.
column6: when you can no longer see the vehicle over your right shoulder.
column8: when you are 50 feet ahead of the vehicle.

column2: 17. While driving you come upon a sign which says, “reduced speed 35 MPH”. You as a driver should know:
column4: that the new 35 MPH speed zone begins at the next “speed limit” sign.
column6: that the new 35 MPH speed zone begins at this sign.
column8: that you have plenty of time to slow down before the speed zone.
column10: that the sign is put there to harass “good” drivers.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column8: Two-way traffic ahead

column2: 19. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column4: get off the road and check your tires.
column8: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 20. Keeping a space cushion between you and the other vehicles around you is important because it:
column6: gives you time to react to situations.
column8: keeps other drivers alert.
column10: keeps traffic flowing at a safe pace.

column2: 21. If you drive slower than the flow of traffic, you will most likely:
column4: help create a safe driving environment.
column8: interfere with traffic and receive a ticket.

column2: 22. Drivers must yield for emergency vehicles:
column8: when they see a flashing red or blue light or hear a siren.

column2: 23. A flashing red light at an intersection means:
column4: Come to a complete stop and remain stopped as long as the light is red
column8: Stop and yield the right of way.
column10: Stop and wait for the green light

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column8: No U-turns

column2: 25. Drivers can proceed through an intersection with a stop sign, but no stop line or crosswalk:
column4: after coming to a complete stop, when it is safe to proceed.
column6: after stopping at least 50 feet prior to the intersection.
column8: after slowing down to at least 15 MPH before proceeding.
column10: after slowing down to ensure there is no cross-traffic.
